alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:31PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 515 PM MDT... At 428 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Kit Carson, or 18 miles west of Cheyenne Wells. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, localized flooding, wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 141 and 152. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
